website_summaries.verdict: Choose this comforter and sham set if you prefer real cotton and don't need additional sheets.
pros: Premium comforter set that's made of 100 percent cotton and includes a sham
Stylish color pattern is suitable for feminine or masculine decor
Easy to pair with blue or white sheets

website_summaries.verdict: A designer twin comforter set with a fresh, trendy look. Worth paying a bit extra for if you're looking for a high-quality option that's as comfortable as it is attractive.
pros: Excellent quality from a trusted brand
Pure 220 thread cotton is beautifully soft and breathable
Stands out from the crowd with a bold color block striped print

customer_reviews.title: Choose the comforter over duvet .
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Soft Bold colors Cons: No inner tie/loops to secure your duvet insert. I hope you are crafty because you will have to sew in your own ties to keep the duvet insert from shifting. Irregular sizing on Full/Queen. This is not a traditional full/queen size, it is an oversized Queen. This odd sizing has made finding an insert challenging. Overall this is a nice set. However if I were to purchase again, I would buy the comforter set . For the price of this duvet set it should be a standard size duvet insert with inner ties.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Fabric, Well Constructed
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't be more pleased with this comforter. We have it on a Queen bed and no skirt is required; it fully covers the box spring -- might be a tad big on a Full. The design is interesting without being too bold and the blue is saturated, but not overly bright. The fill is well distributed and, after several weeks of use, shows no propensity for piling. It's also quite warm, even with the thermostat set in the low 60's. Very pleased with the construction, design and comfort. Very happy to recommend -- if you like the pattern and blue works with your decor, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: givpilot

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy, Poofy, Item looks pretty good. Comes with two standard shams. Wish they were larger to fit larger pillows. The shams are actually the strange thing about this set. the Lacost fox logo is on different portions of the shams, not matching. So there is one on the top corner and the other sham has it in a bottom corner. So the shams actually don't match. It was very wrinkled and I am having a little trouble getting them out, but the fabric itself feels nice and silky. Also wish it was a tad longer in length so it came down on the end more and/or be able to neatly tuck the sleeping pillows under the quilt.
customer_reviews.author: Sistertex

customer_reviews.title: Great set for my teenage son's room.
customer_reviews.text: This comforter looks great and was a good choice for my teenage son's room. The colors and design are sharp and it looks really good when the bed is all made up. The bedding is well made, with no loose threads or anything like that. It is machine washable if you have a washer that's large enough for the comforter. It should be easier to wash the larger sizes of this blanket in machines that don't have one of those middle agitator pieces. My son has the full/queen and it's a nice large size. Plenty big and is warm enough for most seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Where the Sidewalk Ends

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fun design
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sucker for stripes, so this comforter really appeals from a design perspective. It's a great style for men or women, with a combination of pale gray stripes at the sides (running sideways), navy blue stripes running from the head to the foot of the bed in two widths, and a central checked band of dusty periwinkle. White piping around the edges finishes it off cleanly. It's 100% cotton - soft, but feels sturdy - and reversible. It comes with 2 pillow shams. Well made and very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: jhl

customer_reviews.title: Attractive with the right amount of filling.
customer_reviews.text: This full/queen comforter set is very nice quality and looks great on our bed. Its color block striped pattern is striking. It fits our queen bed nicely and has a brushed texture making it extra soft. it is made of 100% cotton and has two matching shams with a similar style. The filling is just the right amount of fluff for our liking. It is comfortable, warm and attractive. It is priced fairly for a comforter by Lacoste. We love it.

customer_reviews.title: Nice comforter set

If you need additional types of pillows to go with the set, they are available, just not on this site. Luckily, I just don't need all the extra pillows, they never get to look pretty on the bed for long. This always looks good on your bed.

They are beautiful. You feel like a under a weighted blanket. Our bed is king and it gives a nice coverage. The shams tuck in neatly.

The fabric is soft, the filling is thick enough to be full and comforting, but not too heavy. I had moved my daughter to a duvet - she hated it. This is hers and she is loving it!! Colors, style, and coziness are all winners!!

The comforter is warm but not stifling - this is a great item for transitional seasons! Best for autumn and spring rather than winter. The pillow cases look good too.

customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Big Beautiful Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I recently visited Macy’s in a local mall in the hunt for a new quilt for my wife’s and my bed. I’d say the patterns, color and quality of this comforter is as good as any we saw. The blanket works quite well, it’s kept us warm without being oppressively heavy. Manufacturing quality seems quite good, there are no odors. I like the narrow edging between the front and back sections. Just a fine example of modern textile production. It is much too bulky for a home washing machine though, so be prepared for the occasional laundromat.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn R. Howes

customer_reviews.title: Shades of a winter  resort
customer_reviews.text: This comforter set looks like a duvet with shams, but is really an unquilted comforter. Some reviewers have mentioned the lack of tacking or quilting, but I have had no issues so far with the stuffing crawling or moving. It is wonderful to sleep under, and generously covers my full sized bed. Be aware that dry cleaning is suggested, but the composition is cotton with polyester fill, so the risk is yours. I am happy with this product.

This premium material is also highly durable and stands up to pilling and fraying, even after multiple cycles through a washing machine.
